ARABIC: فَلَمَّا جَنَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلَّيْلُ رَءَا كَوْكَبًا قَالَ هَٰذَا رَبِّى فَلَمَّآ أَفَلَ قَالَ لَآ أُحِبُّ ٱلْءَافِلِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When night covered him he saw a star and said, 'This is my Lord!' Then when it set he said, 'I do not love what sets.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star, and (Azar, his father) said: "This is my Lord." But when the star set, (Abraham) said: "I love not those that wane."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then, when the night outspread over him, he beheld a star, and said: 'This is my Lord.' But when it went down, he said: 'I do not love the things that go down.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When it became dark at night, he (Abraham) saw a star and said, "This is my lord." But when it disappeared, he said, "I do not love those who fade away".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So when the night became dark upon him he saw a star; he said (to Azar / the people), “(You portray that) this is my Lord?”; then when it set he said, “I do not like the things that set.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When the night overcame him he saw a Kawkab. He said: "This is my lord." But when it Afala, he said: "I like not those that set."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So when the night over-shadowed him, he saw a star; said he: Is this my Lord? So when it set, he said: I do not love the setting ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: When night outspread over him he saw a star and said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set he said, 'I love not the setters.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When the night grew dark upon him he beheld a star. He said: This is my Lord. But when it set, he said: I love not things that set.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When night descended on him, he saw a star. He said, "This is my Lord!" Then when it set he said, "I do not love things that set."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when the night darkened on him, he beheld a star. He said: this is mine Lord. Then when it set, he said. I love not the setting ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When night darkened over him, he saw a star and said, ‘This is my Lord!’ But when it set, he said, ‘I do not like those who set.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When the night covered him over, He saw a star: He said: "This is my Lord." But when it set, He said: "I love not those that set."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When the night covered him over with darkness he saw a star. He said: "This is my lord." But when it set, he said: "I like not those that set."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When night drew over him, he saw a planet. 'This' he said: 'is surely my Lord' But when it set he said: 'I do not like the setting ones'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the night fell over him, he saw a planet. He said, “This is my lord.” But when it set, he said, “I do not love those that set.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that disappear."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [6:76] When night descended, [when] it darkened, upon him he saw a star — said to have been Venus — and said, to his people, who were astrologers: ‘This is my Lord’, as you [are wont to] claim. But when it set, when it disappeared, he said, ‘I love not those that set’, to take them as lords, because it is not possible for a [true] Lord to be transformed or to change place, as such [attributes] pertain to accidents — but this had no effect on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When the night grew dark upon him) in the hole (he beheld a star) the planet Venus. (He said: This is my Lord) could this be my Lord? (But when it set) when its colour changed to red and it disappeared, (he said: I love not things that set) I do not love a lord that is not lasting.
